name: Hedgehog Bread
author: cruella
summary: I live in Germany and needed a quick appetizer to serve friends. I adapted the quantities and temperature for the USA. I hope you like this recipe idea. This appetizer is the bomb (could be cholesterol bomb)! It's a little easier to eat with forks, or enjoy by pulling apart with your fingers.
ingredients: ¼ cup chopped garlic, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package Raclette cheese, sliced into pieces
1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Cut a checkerboard pattern of 1-inch square segments into most of the loaf, leaving the bottom crust intact
Combine Swiss cheese, bacon, butter, and garlic in a bowl
Spoon the mixture between the loaf segments
Stuff the loaf with slices of Raclette
Drizzle olive oil all over the top; sprinkle with salt
Place loaf on a pizza stone
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, about 35 minutes
